title: Give it a try! I'm really glad I did!
text:
I use this to set and refresh my make up. I've never used a setting product before but this was recommend in another review so I thought I'd try it. I was somewhat skeptical since the ingredients all seem so..... NORMAL in this day and age of every product needing some fancy new buzzword exotic ingredient or new innovative chemical.... I figured I'd try it but didn't expect much since most of the aforementioned wowee-zowy miracle buzzword products (which this isn't) give me underwhelming results. But I've been really surprised what a difference this product makes! And the smell is really nice.

I have break-out prone skin and I've had no breakouts since using this product and if anything my skins been much easier to deal with. I don't know if that has anything to do with using this or not, but at the very least I can say it's definitely not breaking me out or anything. But because of my skin I usually have to put my foundation on thick and also try to camouflage some decent-sized areas of my face since my breakouts tend to cluster. Anyone in the same boat knows that it's really hard to do without creating a patchy uneven look and a heavy coating that looks nothing like tge texture of skin. I feel like this spray does a great job of adding a more natural finish to my makeup as well as smoothing out/blending in/hiding the areas which before definitely looked like I was trying to hide something. I'll definitely keep using this product. Plus it's nice to find something effective that's going to last a long time and which I don't have to save up for to afford.

title: Luxury Beauty? Meh.. Has added PERFUME and ARTIFICIAL COLORS dyes
text:
Just.. ok. Barely

Pro: Two in a pack- yay! Spray bottles are easier than dabbing with cotton ball. I keep one bottle with my face care and one in my purse. I spritz as a toner, I spritz to freshen up my face and sometimes even my hair. Works in a pinch to freshen up the air. I don't really notice any benefit. Nor do I notice anything bad in terms of effectiveness. In that, I am truly neutral (3 stars)

CON: The added coloring is totally unnecessary, as is the added fragrance. WHY do that? The latter isn't obnoxious, but it could do without. (1 star). Questionable ingredients. I usually run ingredients through EWG (environmental working group) to see how it rates, but I failed to do so before deciding on this purchase. Shame on me.

Stay away if you have sensitive skin, scent nausea, or conditions like Rosacea where anything can trigger a flare up.

Clean up the ingredients, take out the fake coloring and perfume. This will be my only purchase of this brand when there are better out there.

In the mean time, buy your own ingredients and make your own hydrating toner/refresher.

title: AHH-MAZING
text:
This stuff is amazing. There's no other word for it. I purchased this because my skin has been completely going off the rails lately and my chin has been breaking out yet has been extremely dry, flaky, and has been peeling and irritated, almost like its chapped. It's been quite painful and I've used every oil, every moisturizer with healing/calming benefits I can get my hands on and nothing has worked to moisturize and calm my skin until this.

This spray smells amazing. It smells just like fresh roses. It is not oily or greasy, yet my skin drinks it in and has become softer, less irritated and the peeling and flakiness have completely subsided. My breakouts are reduced by half and are no longer painful and red. My skin is really starting to normalize and it's only been a day and a half! Everything I've used on my skin lately has stung except for this spray. I can't even begin to explain the relief I've experienced since my first spray.

This spray does not make your skin feel taught or dry after it dries like some setting/facial mists I have tried in the past. It leaves your skin plump, moisturized and comfortable.

I can't wait to continue using this spray and see what effects it continues to have on my skin and how it works with makeup. I haven't been able to wear makeup in the last few weeks because of my skin issue, and I'm going to wait a few more days to attempt it, but I'm anticipating a lot of good things.

This spray says once you try it you won't want to be without it...well, that couldn't be more accurate. This spray is one of the best skincare products I have found in recent memory and definitely worth the time and investment. Couldn't be happier and neither could me skin.

title: My absolute favorite mist!
text:
I LOVE this face mist!
This is perfect for my super sensitive skin. Most face mists I've tried in the past have either been too acidic leaving my face red, or my skin feeling tight. This is gentle, lightweight, and moisturizing. I love using it in the morning, as it has a lovely rosewater scent with a hint of aloe and feels refreshing on my skin. It is also good for a mid-day fresh-up if your skin is starting to feel dull. In the morning I use it on clean skin before applying moisturizer, but when I use it later in the day I'll spray it over my makeup. The mist is fine enough that it has not caused my makeup to run.

title: Pleasant smell, but what's the purpose of spraying yourself in the face?
text: I don't understand the great reviews, so I feel obligated to share my negative impression of this facial spray. To be clear, there's nothing wrong with it. It has a pleasant smell, but I don't understand the purpose. I don't see how it's refreshing or moisturizing in any way. I suppose spraying something on your face can wake you up if you're feeling drowsy, but I'm fairly sure water could do that too. If you enjoy spraying something on your face during the day, you'll like this. Reading the description, I expected it would, but that was  not my experience.

I use it in different ways- sometimes after I shave or wax my legs or arm pits to give the skin a chance to recover without deodorant like before bed or I use it on my face when I don't want to cleanse with micellar but feel I need to be freshened or moisturized.  Not bad, just not using every day.  Worth trying if you like natural rose scents.

title: I seriously hate having to rub moisturizer on my skin every morning ...
text: I seriously hate having to rub moisturizer on my skin every morning and evening, and so I was looking for something more convenient. I had purchased a small canister of aerosol moisture mist from L'Occitane that worked really well, but was extremely expensive. Once that ran out I was on the hunt for a more cost effective alternative. Searching Amazon I found this and browsed the reviews. I now use this every day in the morning after my shower, and at night before going to bed. The spray has a light lovely rose smell, and drys quickly on my skin. I no longer have the winter dry patches I was developing, and my skin isn't irritated by the ingredients. This will be a permanent addition to my daily face care routine, and I honestly think it works better than the specialty brand spray I used before.

title: A MUST-HAVE!
text: WOW!!! I am beyond ecstatic to find a product so light and refreshing.I've struggled with hormonal acne for many years and have an extremely OILY face, especially during hot/humid days in Hawaii!!! Moisturizers aggravate my skin, so I wanted to find a lighter product that has adequate ingredients to hydrate my face without causing a breakout. I am so glad to have found Badescu's Rose Water spray. It makes my skin and LIPS look and feel like a baby's skin! It gives me a healthy radiant glow. I do tend to mist my face more frequently than normal, at least every 2 hours. I noticed that my face is less likely to be oily, especially by midday, by doing so.

title: LOVE
text:
Another BuzzFeed List suggestion that I had relatively low expectations for and ended up pleasantly surprised. This spray is now part of my daily routiene.

I had purchased it as a refresher spray to keep in my purse back in the summer, but when I read the label and it was also suggested as a part of your moisturizing routiene, I started using it that way and never stopped.

The scent is very fresh and pleasant without being at all over-powering. It has a faint herbal, clean smell. I have very sensitive skin and this not only doesn't irritate it, it actually soothes it. My skin is also very fair and I can tend to get an almost pasty, washed-out look pretty easily and this stuff actually brightens me up a great deal.

The value for the money really can't be beat. You could pay at least 5x this at Sephora for a product that wouldn't be nearly as great.

title: Tis the shiz-niz
text:
I first saw/heard of this product from one of those stupid Click-bait articles. Probably Diply... Anyway, I finally decided to see what it was all about and found it at this low price here on amazon.

I live in FL and my skin is average to dry, but anyone who's lived or visited Satan's B-hole, I mean Florida, knows that there's really only about a month that has legit cool weather. That being said, I'm a sweaty gal and this gal gets a little sweatier and slip-slides on any leather or plastic seat from my awesomely lotioned skin.

THIS product, however, HELPS to not make my freshly showered face a greased up mess by misting a light moisturizer that absorbs into my overly active hormonal sweaty skin. I can rehydrate my flaky nose, lip line, and brows while not having to towel it off. Once it dries I can mist again all over to give another boost of hydration, move on with my day, and I don't have to look like a preteen boy who's just been caught with dirty socks under his bed.

Tossing the facial lotions out and making this a staple in my daily routine. Thanks Mario B.

title: That Smell Though
text:
Honestly I should of looked more into this product before buying it. I have no idea how well this works which is why I'm going to rate it a 4 star. Personally for me....I cannot stand the smell of this product so I will not be using it. This product may be fantastic and I saw this product in an article raving about it...which is the reason I found it and purchased it.

The only help this review may truly help is this...if you do not like floral scents I wouldn't recommend it. To me it smells like a floral shop that also dings the smell of death to my brain because I literally have only been in floral shops to get flowers for funerals. My daughter claims it smells like an old woman and she despises the scent just as much as me, and lastly my husband said it smells horrible as well. From reading reviews below, many do like this scent, and you may as well....just be aware you to may think this smells really bad, and wouldn't want to apply it anywhere near your nose.

Other than me hating the smell the price is really great, and it arrived fast, and it arrived in perfect condition hadn't leaked or been damaged. I do apologize that I couldn't leave a better review as to how the product works...

title: Great product at a great price
text: This is great to have at work to revive my parched face midday now that the furnace is on full-blast. It doesn't disturb my makeup (I cover my eyes with my hands) and it absorbs quickly. A few reviewers are upset about the chemical additives in the spray, but to be honest, a mixture of aloe, rose water, and herbs likely wouldn't last long at room temperature without some kind of preservatives. I agree the added fragrance is unnecessary, though. Pure rose water is an option, though I don't know how hydrating it would be alone. I'm so happy I found this; I was just another to pull the trigger on Glossier's hydrating face mist, which is $18 for 4 oz. (the same size as this bottle), and it too contains chemical additives. Saving $11 and getting a product with tons of great reviews seems like a good idea in my book.

title: It’s the bomb !
text:
I’ve used this Mario Badesco “Rose water”and “Lavender” hydrating skin fresheners for over 25 years ! I cook a lot, and give large dinner parties regularly. SOO my secret for healthy glowing skin and a rested face is simple ! I keep a small bottle of ROSEWATER SCENT, in my kitchen refrigerator. It perks up my pre- moisturized facial skin ! When I’m slaving over “red hot” double convection ovens, and need a cool refreshing break.. I drench my face in its WONDERFUL SCENT AND A BRACING SPRAY, OF PURE REFRESHMENT, for a need lift! So, “chefs” lay out your party clothes,ahead, wash and cream your face..PUT ON YOUR APRON, and comfy shoes, open the refrigerator door, and enjoy your first spray of iced cold M.B. “Rose Water” spray, do that at least every hour you’re over that hot stove !! ALSO COMES IN RESTFUL LAVENDER SPRAY, use after your bedtime facial routine or before a pre-party nap, or before going to sleep !
Do NOT USE WHILE COOKING…Lavender is VERY RELAXING, wouldn’t want to fall asleep in the “ BEOUF AUX CHAMPIONS” ! As Julia Child would say “Bon Appetite !! BUT, Before bedtime it’s THE LAVENDER SCENT and “BONNE NUIT” !!

title: I use this spray multiple times a day! Love it!
text: For my skin care routine, I first start with the shea moisture African black soap system. After cleansing my face with that, I put 2 drops of jojoba oil, and 2 drops of rosehip seed oil in my wet palm..rub my hands together and massage into my face and neck. I follow that with the moisturizer for problem skin that came in the shea moisture African black soap kit, and finish with a few sprays of this. The combination of all of this has my combination, acne prone, sensitive, dry skin, looking the best it has looked since I was a child!! I don't use this as a setting spray because the spray that is on the bottle is too strong and causes my make up to look blotchy..but on days I'm not wearing any make up, I use this throughout the day to refresh my face. It feels amazing during a hot summer day while I am laying out! Best rose water spray out there! I have also used this on my 2 son's sunburn, and they both said that it made it not hurt anymore. The sun burn did not peel like it usually does, and it was less red when they woke up in the morning. Love this stuff and will continue to purchase!!

title: Perfect for sensitive skin
text: It seems kind of silly that a rose water spray would make such a huge difference - but it totally does! I have hormonal pregnant skin and use 4-5 spritz of this religiously every morning and night after I was my face. It keeps my mild eczema prone skin from flaking in any season, and is not so heavily moisturizing that it clogs my pores throughout the day/night. Makes my skin feel refreshed and light, definitely helps prevent my skin from those irritable hormonal breakouts! Would definitely recommend giving this a try!

It also dissipates after a few minutes, so not worried about any lingering aroma. I've found that my skin loves it which is great because I have dehydrated, acne-prone skin.

I wanted to try a spray that I could use before my moisturizer and also to gently set my makeup and was recommended to try this.

I like it so far. Been using a few weeks now. My makeup looks fresh for longer than when I'm not using a spray, but I don't have other sprays to compare it to. Makeup does move after a bit, but my skin drinks it up and loves it.

I used it before i put on my daily moisturizers (just spray once towards your face with eyes closed) and never noticed any problems with skin sensitivity. I was pretty happy about that.

My only complaint is that this particular scent makes you smell like your grandmas perfume. It isn't that bad once you get a layer of moisturizer on top of it, but I find that it still lingers around hours after use.

I think I will try a different scent and find the results much better, but overall, I think the product was nice aside from smelling like something you might find from your grandmas perfume drawer.

Not something you should be putting on your face. I used it on my face after a shower, and it immediately started stinging. I decided I wanted to try it again after applying a great moisturizer and it once again made my skin sting, and start to dry it out. I can see how if you don't have sensitive or dry skin this could be a decent product. For me personally I don't also want to spray my face with red and blue dyes.

title: Love this! I have used a different brand toner ...
text: Love this! I have used a different brand toner which is also a spray toner for about ten years and I have tried other brands along the road but would always immediately go back to that one because it just worked for me but I had heard so many good things about this one from you tube so I thought I would try it I mean it wasn’t too expensive. I bought it and I couldn’t be happier it’s hydrating but not in a way to leave you feeling greasy or heavy. I didn’t care for the rose smell at first but now I am used to it and don’t mind it at all. The only thing that would make me give it a full 5 star review is if the spray was better. It’s a thicker spray that makes me feeling quite wet and it gets in my hair as well. Fix the spray nozzle and I will use forever!!

title: Favorite Makeup add

title: 2nd ingredient is propylene glycol!
text: Second ingredient is propylene glycol, which is used in antifreeze to keep it from freezing, in cosmetics to break down your skin. It's very irritating, too. So, if you want to pump your face full of this stuff, be my guest, but I'm not, and they don't let you return it... In the trash it goes! Ugh. Wish I had read the reviews instead of trusting the number of stars. Most people are sheep. Use heritage state products. All good for you, no fillers or chemicals. Their rosewater and glycerin is just ionized water, glycerin and rosewater and don't even get me started on their rosewater toner. It's got glycerin, hyaluronic acid, water, rosewater, aloe. That's about it! None of the chemicals! So good for your skin. It's fabulous! Cheaper, too. I found them at Target and my skin is glowing! Do yourself a favor and go with them! Wish I had done my homework, but oh well. Hopefully my review helps some people!

title: Irritaing Chemicals No Rosewater
text: Anyone considering this should look into rosewater. Rosewater will calm and gently hydrate dry skin, it will tone oily skin, and refresh your sences. Over time, rosewater can help retain youthful qualities of your skin, it can help combat acne. However, this chemical gimmick (which contains zero rosewater) could have severe side effects for some people. For me, itchy red skin for half a day and the annoyance of a horrible smell. It also left a shiney unattractive coating on my skin. I have been using Heritage Rosewater Spray for almost 20 years and everyone loves it, especially women and children, but even grown men appreciate a spritz in the summer, the soft natural scent has not bothered a single person yet.

After reading a lot of reviews, I decided to give this product a try, though it was a little pricey for the quantity.
And now, using it regularly, I am ready to add this to my subscribe and save list! The product is light, has a mild refreshing scent and I use it as a toner, moisturizer and even after make up as a setting spray. I carry one in my gym bag and spray after sweating out! I use it before I put my makeup on, let it dry, and then again after I apply my makeup.

The best part is the price. It costs a 1/3 of the price of the expensive setting sprays like MAC or Smashbox. Don't get me wrong I love their setting sprays as well but I love this one the best for the price and the way it leaves my skin feeling. After each spray on after my makeup, I have noticed that my makeup doesn't move or I don't get as oily as I used to before. I love this stuff and for the price and quality its AWESOME!!!

title: Best facial spray ever!
text:
My skin loves this stuff! I bought this because a Youtuber recommended this, and of course I had to try it because I'm one of those girls. Anyways..

It's super hydrating and makes my face feel soft and refreshed at any time of the day when I use it. It's even nice over makeup as a setting spray. It's pretty much the easiest skin care step ever, you just spray it all over your face (3-4 squirts) and you're done. I use this at night, in the morning, in the middle of the day, before makeup, ect. It's just amazing. I keep it beside my sink in my bathroom with my other skincare products so whenever I go in there I can just squirt it all over my face and boom. Amazing.

It has a soft rose scent that's not too overpowering, which is nice for people who are sensitive to strong perfumes. This small bottle has lasted me about 3 months now and I've recently started using it more and more so it looks like I'll be needing more soon. And at $7 you can't beat the price.

Also, one of the reasons I truly love this stuff is because it doesn't irritate my skin at all. My skin is pretty sensitive to certain skin care products. If I use a new mask or face wash and it just doesn't agree with my skin, my skin will flare up red and start to burn. This does nothing like that. I've even used this to calm down my skin after a bad episode with a mask that irritated my face and it really cooled everything down. I just love this product so much. Don't just take my word for it, read all of the other 5 star reviews as well.

title: A skin care MUST!
text:
This was my first purchase from Mario Badescu, and I am very, very pleased. This facial mist has become one of my staples for my skin care. It is so refreshing, clean, and makes your skin feel hydrated without being oily or greasy. I've been looking for something like this for so long, without it being greasy or oily and this is it, it leaves the skin soft, supple, and hydrated in the best of ways, with NO greasy feel! It absorbs well into the skin, and leaves it feeling smooth and clean. The smell is lovely as well! You can smell the rose petals and it's a very calming effect, and not overbearing at all.
I use it in the morning, night, and randomly whenever I want a refreshed face.

I plan on buying more bottles of this, as well as trying out other products from this line. If you're looking for something to use as a "pick me up" or to refresh your skin, this is it. 10/10!
Shipping was great, came sealed and in great condition.

That being said, I don’t have very sensitive skin, but within minutes of putting this on, my face felt hot and it looked like I had a sunburn... was able to return with no issues... I’m just gonna stick to my organic oils... as far as moisture goes, it does make your skin feel good when you put it on, but when it dries it has a face peel type feeling (so you open your mouth wide to get that peel crack feeling to be able to move the rest of your face again)... the scent was ‘very’ rosey, almost artificial smelling. I won’t buy again, nor do I recommend this product.

title: Contains propylene glycol as second ingredient!
text:
While I wanted to LOVE this stuff, as it smells amazing, and who doesn't want a hydrated face, I got a hive the first night I used it. My face also felt a bit sticky/tacky after it dried. When I checked the ingredients, propylene glycol was listed as second ingredient. PG is not to be used near eyes or as a mist, see info straight from wikipedia, bummer, I really wanted this to work!

"Undiluted propylene glycol is minimally irritating to the eye, producing slight transient conjunctivitis; the eye recovers after the exposure is removed. Exposure to mists may cause eye irritation, as well as upper respiratory tract irritation. Inhalation of propylene glycol vapors appears to present no significant hazard in ordinary applications.[33] However, limited human experience indicates that inhalation of propylene glycol mists could be irritating to some individuals.[34] It is therefore recommended that propylene glycol not be used in applications where inhalation exposure or human eye contact with the spray mists of these materials is likely, such as simulated fogs for theatrical productions, or antifreeze solutions for emergency eye wash stations.[35]"

title: LOVE
text:
I could not rave enough about how much I love this product. I waited a few days just to see if the product would benefit my skin at all (fully expecting to not see or feel a difference). It's now been only 3 and my face has significantly less irritation/redness, it looks and 'feels' healthier, and I'd go as far as to say it's helped clear up my acne. When spraying over my make up, I even found that the makeup looked more natural. The smell is awesome (if you love roses like I do) and my face feels great. So, if you're on the fence about this product--don't be! Definitely get it.

**Update**
It's been nearly a full week now and I'm in love. My acne has definitely lessened, my pores have shrunk, and my face is practically glowing. I use the spray every time after I was my face and let it air dry. You can barely tell the bottle has been used, so I know this is going to last me a long time.

title: Say Goodbye to Dry
text:
I purchased this product after hearing raves about it on YouTube. I travel a lot for work and my skin takes a beating - it always feels so dry and dehydrated. I know a lot of people use this is a toner, but I decided to use it as a skin refresher to help hydrate my skin from a lot of travel. I love this product:
1. It smells very clean and fresh - no medicinal or strong alcohol smell
2. It leaves my skin feeling very hydrated
3. It sprays well over my makeup without causing it to run or muddy.

I transferred this large bottle into several smaller spray bottles so that I could travel with it and to have in my purse all the time. I have found that I reach for this whenever my skin feels dry or dehydrated. It works well while out in the sun as well.

Aside from the benefits of hydration to your skin it also works well on dry damaged hair. I use this to spray on my ends while at the pool or beach to help keep them hydrated and protected.

I highly recommend this product if you have dry, tight, dehydrated skin or dry damaged hair.

title: Insert lots of emojis that express bliss :-)
text: My teenage daughter & I are addicted to this.  I was expecting this to be an item we try out & never purchase again; which is usually how it works for us.  We're into all things beauty: makeup, skincare, health & wellness; so, we try new things for fun constantly.  There are plenty of things we like that we never purchase again; you know, that's just the way it goes usually.  We like to try out the next new thing & usually forget about things that we've tried that have been good but not amazing.  This product is unforgettable.  We have purchased it several times because it is a permanent part of our skincare routine.  We even purchase this as gifts, because it's something many people might not buy for themselves.  Everyone loves this.  It's universally appropriate for all skin types.  We use it as a toner, makeup setting spray, to refresh our makeup as needed, & just to lift our mood when we're feeling blah.  You won't know how you ever lived w/out it after you try it.  :-)

title: Good for Skin and Amazing for Hair!
text: I enjoy the refreshing, cooling sensation this gives when sprayed on the face; it gives a boost of hydration before my moisturizer, and also works well as a setting spray. But the best benefit I've gotten is from spraying it in my hair! My limp, thin, baby-fine hair has never looked better or felt stronger. I had read somewhere after purchasing this spray for my face that it was also good for hair, but didn't mention any specifics; I tried it because, oh well, couldn't hurt (and it made my hair smell nice). After 2 months, I see a real difference. Doing research, it turns out that hydrocarbons in rose petals help strengthen the hair cuticle. Huzzah! I will never be without this product again.

title: Not good for your skin
text: For a spray that seems so natural and good for your skin, this really breaks me out! I have read that there are dyes in this to make the pink color of the spray which is also disappointing.  Essentially I think this is just perfume for your face and does not actually do much of anything to hydrate or tone. I tried using this again after awhile thinking something else might have broken out my usually clear skin but the bumps and zits returned as soon as I restarted using this. Skip this one and go for organic pure rose water spray next time!

title: Like it More Than I Thought I Would
text: I love Mario Badescu's products and always spray my face, in store, from the tester. I finally bought it and love it more than I expected to. Not only is it refreshing, but also moisturizing, in ways that the water facial mists aren't, due to the addition of aloe in this spray. My favorite use has been to "set" my makeup. Applied directly after my makeup application, it seems to give my face polish, a more finished look. I use 1-2 spritzes at a time so it seems like it will last forever. It has a faint rose smell, which always makes me smile, and fades rather quickly. It has become one of my fave products.

title: The smell is too strong
text: I couldn’t use it because the smell was so strong that it made me nauseous.

title: Nurses, buy this. You need it.
text: 12+ hour shifts on my feet, sweating like a marathon runner, were leaving me looking a hot mess. Thanks to this product, no more skin redness, oily, shiny, sweaty face, makeup melting off and creasing in my wrinkles (ew, seriously)... none of that nasty now. I use this as a setting spray in the morning and then refresh myself once I get to work, at lunch, and then before I leave for the day. When I get home I look fresh AF and have that dewy early 20-something look about my skin that makes my husband go "come here, baby." I'm getting all the ladies at work hooked on this stuff. It's like crack for your skin. Even got the dudes wondering what they're missing out on trying to act like they're not interested but I see them listening curiously when us girls use it. My acne is clearing up - not sure if it's the aloe in the product? Or maybe just that it's really good at setting my makeup in place and keeps it hydrated, so my skin is less oily? Either way, I'm not going to ask anymore questions because whatever it is, it's working. About damned time I found something like this. TRY IT.

title: treat your skin to an afternoon pick-me-up
text:
If you notice that the air feels dry or that you need lip balm or lotion (or you just have dry cuticles) then you may need to re-hydrate your face too!

This makes my skin instantly feels hydrated. Within 5 minutes my skin feels slightly plumper and slightly firmer (not sure if there are any lasting benefits).

It's a bit pricey for me, yet the rose smells like fresh roses (not like an old lady) and the smell quickly fades and doesn't change to stale - it's very pleasant and not over powering. That said this could be a bit feminine smelling for most guys.

title: Trying a new Rose Water
text:
When this arrived each bottle was individually wrapped in a plastic zip locked baggie.
(If the temp was any hotter the day it arrived or it if it a longer ship time -I believe this would have leaked in the baggies, in my opinion. I prefer each spray top to be tapped along with the individually wrapped in a plastic zip locked baggie tapped at the top as well. Other Amazon sellers package products similar to this one like this already.) Sometime Amazon packages multiple items in the same box and mine came with an other item that could have been damaged if these bottles leaked.)
I tested each bottle to check if these were the "actual" products sent. Each smelled, so far wonderful and subtle (the sent didn't last too long) I could smell what was listed to be in the product. There wasn't anything on the plastic bottle to inform me if it was recyclable or what type of plastic it was. This is a concern since my previous go-to rose water(That I've been buying for over 3 years) the plastic bottle it comes in and how the product is delivered onto your skin every time you use it -I just found out, it's made from a harmful plastic(?)
Since this Rose Water has a better "rating" and a "Amazon's Buyer Choice/Recommended" I decided to try this enhanced "Rose Water"
I noticed that the reviews are varied depending on person and what "bottle" of product they received (which is scary! Is there someone handling quality control or monitoring these possible third party sellers? I hope Amazon is helping buyers of these possible dupes who've suffered from skin problems) and I'm going to watch my skin very closely since I do have sensitive skin and feel/look of my skin and smell is VERY important to me.
I will update this review after awhile of use.

title: Love this product!

I ordered this and decided maybe it would be a good idea to put the rose spray on my nose, all I was doing then was putting neosporin on my nose and that wasn’t working. So I started to spray it on my nose and then put neosporin over it. And now it’s gone and my nose actually looks normal. So of course, I’m very happy with this product. title: Makeup tip ahoy!
text: I learned a handy makeup tip for use with rose water: spray it on after every layer (foundation, blush, etc) and it will make the makeup look more like skin, and less like, well, makeup.  I've been using this facial spray for a few weeks now, and it really does work.  My face looks healthy and glowy, quite a bit more than before, and the makeup seems to almost melt into my skin and give it a perfected look, rather than sitting on top.  Bonus: I think my skin's actual condition has improved when I take the makeup off, as well.  This stuff is great!

title: My K-Beauty Routine
text:
At 32 I had stubborn hormonal acne and dry flaky skin (thanks in part to the dry climate in Colorado) I was tired of constantly fighting my skin and embarked on a journey to get the clear youthful skin I deserved. I was pleased to find that the skin of my dreams in a Korean beauty inspired routine. The best part is that nearly all the products I tried were relatively inexpensive and readily available from amazon. My acne is non-existent now and the tone and texture of my skin is so supple and smooth. I have provided a list of my routine below which includes this product. I’m not saying this is the best or only way to achieve my results, I just thought others would be interested in what I used.

*indicates review for this product

AM- hydrating, lightweight, works under makeup

Cleanser - [[ASIN:B00BN7PVXK BOOTS Botanics All Bright Gentle Cleansing Cream]] (purchased from Ulta for a fraction of the price $6.99)

*First Toner- [[ASIN:B002LC9OES Mario Badescu Facial Spray with Aloe, Herbs and Rosewater, 4 oz.]]– $7.00 - This is like a drink of water for your face. I love this stuff and will spray again randomly throughout the day whenever I need a refresher. The aroma is a little strong for my liking but (almost like perfume) but I’m willing to overlook since the rose and aloe does so much for my skin. I used to use just straight rose water which has a very present smell but I like the spray delivery of this product better.

Moisturizing Toner-[[ASIN:B00PBJSOWQ [Skin Food] Premium Avocado Rich Toner 180ml]] –$12.98 - I can’t say enough about this. It’s a nice thick toner much more substantial that the western watery toners I was used to. The smell of this is very bright and green (that’s the best way I can think of to explain it) I love the smell! Every now and then I will smell it on my face and it gives me an invigorating boost. This toner works well to moisturize and calm my skin and will certainly be re-purchasing. A little goes a long way with this stuff so that won’t be for quite some time!

Treatment- [[ASIN:B00NQHFGMG Body Merry Hyaluronic Acid Serum for Anti-aging with Vitamic C and Natural Green Tea, 2 Oz]]– $13.99 - I use this during the day to keep my skin feeling hydrated and give my skin the boost of anti-oxidants to help combat ageing. This is a lightweight serum (which is why I use it under my makeup) but it does take some time to fully absorb in and dry on my skin. After I put this on I generally go and have breakfast before coming back to finish. The aroma leans more towards green tea which again I find refreshing for the morning. The syrup is a milky and slightly viscous with minimal stickiness.

Eye Cream- [[ASIN:B00C9EKOHY Loreal Revitalift Eye Cream 0.5 Ounce (14ml)]] (14ml) – (Purchased from Ulta)

Face Cream- [[ASIN:B00NTR9B6A [MIZON] Snail Recovery Gel Cream 45ml (1.52 fl.oz.) Pack of 2]]– $9.99/ 2-pack - Lightweight moisturizer which works perfectly under makeup. This product doesn’t’ have much of a smell. The consistency is unique halfway between a gel and a cream. Glides on smoothly and provides a decent amount of hydration when combines with my other hydrating products. I don’t like to use occlusive products during the day and this moisturizer fits the bill.

PM-all about Snail- Repair, Hydrated, Moisturize

Makeup Remover- [[ASIN:B00G0JN5FM Boots Botanics All Bright Soothing Eye Make-up Remover 5 oz.]] – Purchased at Ulta for a fraction of the price - $6.99

Double Cleanse -[[ASIN:B00SUZWGHM [Total 2Pcs] The Face Shop Rice Water Bright Cleansing Oil + Foam SET]] –$14.21 - The oil cleanser feels light and silky. At night, I massage 1 pump into my skin and works well to dissolve the days make-up. Once I am done breaking down all the makeup, I use water to get some of it off before moving to the foam cleanser. My only complaint is that the fragrance is a little strong and can burn my eyes if I’m not careful. It leaves my skin feeling soft and clean. The foam cleanser works well to clean off the oil left on my face. The foam cleanser aroma is a lot more tolerable to me. It comes out of the tube a shimmery white color and is Very gentle. These two cleansers work well to get my face clean and ready for treatments without that typical tight feeling. They leave my skin soft and moisturized.

Exfoliation - [[ASIN:B000F63TW0 Olay Regenerist Microdermabrasion & Peel System Microdermabrasion Treatment 1 Kit]] - $21.99 - one a week - I used to use philosophy's microderm kit but this one offers the same exact results for 1/2 of the price. This exfoliator leaves my skin feeling baby soft but it does seem a tad harsh so I don't like to use it too frequently. I love the fresh citrus smell of the crystals and the warming foaming action once you put on the activator. Since I only use this once a week it lasts for a VERY long time and is totally worth the price.

Toner- [[ASIN:B00PBJSOWQ [Skin Food] Premium Avocado Rich Toner 180ml]] –$12.98 I can’t say enough about this. It’s a nice thick toner much more substantial that the western watery toners I was used to. The smell of this is very bright and green (that’s the best way I can think of to explain it) I love the smell! Every now and then I will smell it on my face and it gives me an invigorating boost. This toner works well to moisturize and calm my skin and will certainly be re-purchasing. A little goes a long way with this stuff so that won’t be for quite some time!

Essence - [[ASIN:B00PBX3L7K [Cosrx] Advanced Snail 96 Mucin Power Essence 100ml]] – $15.85 - I only use this at night because it does leave bit of a film on my face which I find unpleasant under make up. It dries quickly and a single pump gives me enough to cover my whole face and neck. There is no smell to speak of but it does have a slimy snail-y texture ( it is 96% slime!) and can be a bit tacky once its all said and done. I have also used this on some iron burns to help it heal faster and minimize scaring with a lot of success.

Treatment-[[ASIN:B00B73SMFY MIZON Snail Repair Intensive Ampoule - Anti Wrinkle - Multi Function Formula]] - $11.43 - Anti Wrinkle - Multi Function Formula- Clear viscous liquid. Not nearly as slimy as the essence. No smell, absorbs quickly. I focus heavily on the snail products at night because I read that the copper peptides naturally contained in the snail can
alter the effectiveness of the vitamin C and vice versa.

Spot Treatment-[[ASIN:B00AFNYMFG [MIZON] Acence Blemish Out Pink Spot 30ml]]– $14.95 - Use only as needed – Works wonders to diminish blemishes overnight. I used this quite frequently when I first started but after a while using all these products I didn’t have any acne to speak of!

Sheet Mask - [[ASIN:B00BAM7F8C Dermal Korea Collagen Essence Full Face Facial Mask Sheet, 16 Combo Pack]] – $10.40 - I use once a week. I know that sheet masks are the totally hot thing in Korean beauty but I don’t think they do much for me other than a relaxing home spa experience. I just don’t see that they provide much and probably will not be buying more.

Eye Cream- [[ASIN:B00AFLSE7U MIZON Korean Cosmetics Snail Repair Eye Cream, 1 Ounce]] 1 Ounce – $13.98 - Light weight, absorbs quickly. The container is quite generous and a little will go a long way. I think I will have this for a while! It doesn’t have any smell.

Face Cream- [[ASIN:B00B4PWEJU MIZON Black Snail All In One Cream, 2.40 Ounce]] –$10.49 - Like all of the Mizon Snail products I have tried this is a very easy introduction into the world of snail skin care. It has minimum smell and lightweight texture. Minimal slime factor, you wouldn’t even know it was snail in a blind comparison. It has a off white color and a lightweight consistency. It doesn’t work wall as an occlusive if that’s what you want you may need to add a different moisturizer at night.

Face Oils- I use a mixture of two oils applied at once: [[ASIN:B00LNOV8JO Radha Beauty Rosehip Oil 4 oz - 100% Pure Cold Pressed Certified Organic]]. - $13.95 - and [[ASIN:B01GUEVP7G Radha Beauty Moroccan Argan Oil for Hair, Face & Skin 4 oz - USDA Organic 100% Pure Cold pressed Virgin Oil From Morocco - By Radha Beauty]] –$12.95 - I like to use the oils last because I feel like it really seals everything in and provides moisture to last me through the night. The rosehip oil is very yellow orange so I wouldn’t recommend using during the day abut I do sometimes mix the Argan oil in with my foundation if I want a dewier look.

title: Great for restoring moisture
text: I got this a few months ago, so I can finally testify to its effectiveness and wow! Using this in combo with Shea Moisture’s African Black Soap, Thayers Facial Toner Witch Hazel (Rose Petal), Derma E Tea Tree & Vitamin E oil, and some homemade moisturizer (consisting primarily of aloe vera) and I can confidently say my face is 40% clearer. I’m 20 years old and still going through puberty somehow (like legit still growing and stuff), so acne, oily skin, and red spots have been a problem for what has seemed like forever despite cleaning my face multiple times a day and rarely wearing makeup or touching my face. After a solid month of using all of these products every morning though, my face is so much clearer. This rose water is mainly to restore some good moisture after cleaning all the oils off and somewhat drying everything out. But the rest of the products I listed are all under or about $10 so if you want a face care routine, feel free to steal mine (as mine is a knockoff of Zendaya’s anyway lol).

title: Propylene glycol
text:
This product smelled nice and had a really moisturizing feel and I'm sure works really well for most people. Unfortunately, the propylene glycol created problems for me.
I assumed this was fairly pure like some other rose water sprays I'd purchased, but simply mixing a spritz with lotion caused my skin to peel. Propylene glycol is in a million products so that doesn't make this bad or dangerous, but just something to be aware of if you're sensitive to PG.

title: I have never used this to set my make up but I do like using it before a foundation primer if I'm getting ...
text: I had never tried this facial spray in the previous formulation some reviewers have mentioned, so I can't make any comparisons. It has a lovely light scent and feels quite refreshing on the face (about four sprays is sufficient for me to feel freshened up). I have never used this to set my make up but I do like using it before a foundation primer if I'm getting done up after a day of going bare-faced. I'll also occasionally use this to tame flyaway hairs with great success. Again, I can't make any comparisons to prior formulas, but I'm very happy with its present form!

title: Smells fantastic. It's definitely moisturizing
text:
Smells fantastic. It's definitely moisturizing. I put it on my face if my skin is dry, but I find that it can make my skin get oily faster than normal if I do that on a day that I'm very active, or if it's hot out.
Works great on my hair on windy or dry days. Keeps my hair from developing static cling.
Some say this works as a setting spray, but I find that the opposite is true. As I said earlier, if it's a hot day and/or if I'm very active, it makes my skin get oily faster, so it can make my makeup melt a little more easily.

title: 18 year old, sensitive, combination, acne prone skin
text: This facial spray is very hydrating, smells great, and feels really amazing on my face. I am constantly going through bottles of it and have to keep restocking. I wouldn't say that it's a necessary step in my daily skincare routine, I can definitely do without it, but it is something I want to keep incorporating because it makes me feel great and acts as a pick me up. Most importantly, the spray is not irritating at all and soothes my skin when I need it to. Mario Badescu's products are all fantastic, and I wouldn't hesitate to give this spray a try. If you're on a budget, however, and only have limited money to spend on skincare, I would say buy the essentials first and then come back for this spray.

text: I swear up and down that this takes the frizz out of my hair. Whenever I spray this on my hair after a shower and let my hair air dry, I have the best hair day. I wear my hair up all the time (trying to change that now), so much so that my hair is damaged. The frizz it usually out of control, it's poofy, annoying, and I hate it.  This rose water spray completely changes that! I've wanted to start wearing my hair down, naturally (no heat or harmful products), and this product makes my life so much easier. title: AMAZING product for an AMAZING price!!
text:
I absolutely love this product. It is so incredibly versatile, and at a very reasonable price!
I saw a similar product for literally FOUR TIMES the price. Why?!? This right here is amazing!

Here are some ways I have used it already:

Hot on a road trip? Use this to refresh.
Setting make up? Use this spray to set it flawlessly.
Sun burn? The aloe in this soothes it.
Bug bites? Aloe and cool spray soothes them.
Washed your face for the night? Use this as toner. It feels amazing on my skin and seems to really rejuvenate and restore it!
Washed face in the morning? Use as a primer.
Need a random pick me up in the afternoon to wake up? Spritz some of this on your face.
Hot and tired feet after a run or workout? Use this to cool down and soothe.

Seriously, this gets so much use. I didn't expect to love it so much! The smell is light rose, and goes away quickly if you want to use a different perfume and are worried about it. I have been basically spraying it on other people like, "Oh, you're hot? Try this!" Lol.
Fantastic product, highly recommend.

title: Five Stars

title: Completely changed my skincare routine...
text:
Hate the fact is has dyes but LOVE the fact is has literally replaced my entire skin care routine -- I used to have uncontrollable combination skin. Half of my face felt like the Sahara and the other half was a pit stop at the Daytona 500, no matter whether I was wearing make up or not. Most beauty items I had tried failed on me or made me breakout with in a day. A friend suggested I may have sensitive skin, and that this brand may work. She raved about the pimple reducer, which we joked about reminded us of calamine from when we were children. She went on to tell me about how their products are great but can be hit or miss. So I took a risk, well, if you call $7.00 a risk.

And what a great risk that was.

Now my daily skincare routine takes me five minutes, tops. At the bathroom sink I exfoliate oil and blackhead prone areas (without water!) Garnier Charcoal, sweep my face with a soaking konjac sponge (depending on the time of day I'll use a different color), then liberally spray this. All over my face. In two ample circles. And in a downwards angle. I do this entire routine two to four times a day. After two days my blackheads were gone. After a week, my skin looked like porcelain.

Needless to say, this new routine has made a marked difference in my skin -- and how I feel in the skin I'm in. I simpay cannot get over how well it has worked!! My face feels like fine paper to the touch, and I am obsessed with how it smells. I even use it in my hair as suggested.

It works well, smells amazing, has mostly great benefits ... but the ingredients..... please find better colorants. It was literally the first thing I noticed as soon as I received it :( I work at a printing company so I understand how formulas change and ingredients can be difficult to source (I won't even mention last year's vanilla isolate incident...) but last I checked you CAN relabel products such as this.

Overall 4/5 because this stuff changed my life. Lost a star because .... colorants.

title: It's ok
text: It's ok. No better or worse than plain rose water. With the added ingredients I would consider this inferior, as I don't notice any benefits from additional ingredients, but added fragrance does increase risk of irritation. The fragrance doesn't make it any stronger than plain rose water either. I use it to prep skin and set makeup sometimes, but the spray isn't fine enough for ideal makeup setting. Water + glycerin in a fine most spray bottle is better for setting, and a face mist with hyaluronic acid included is my preferred moisturizing pick me up or skin prep before priming/moisturizing.

title: AMAZING as a makeup setting spray
text:
I've been loving this spray for months, but its performance today was so amazing, I finally had to hop on here to review it.

I applied my makeup at 6:30 this morning. I walk a half mile each way to work; today's weather: temps and humidity both in the 80s, so I get a little sticky on the walk each way. When I finally make it home at 6:30 pm - twelve hours on - my makeup looks flawless and I don't touch it up as I head back out. I stand at an outdoor concert for two and a half hours - the wind's died down, so it's sticky out and sweat beads up on my nose and forehead. When I finally get home for the day at 11:30 pm, my makeup looks nearly flawless and almost identical to how it looked SEVENTEEN hours earlier when I applied it. Amazing. This is the greatest beauty tool I can ever imagine. Just try it - you'll love it.

I do two single sprays, once for each side of my face in the morning.

I wear a decent amount of make up and my skin always feels dry and depleted, especially during the winter, so I use this as a pick-me-up throughout the day to re-hydrate and refresh. It won't sully your make up and absorbs quickly leaving you with a dewy glow. Truthfully, I've taken to spraying this liberally all over my face, hair, neck, and arms-- literally everywhere. The best part is that it feels like a luxury splurge item, but is totally budget friendly. Buy the big bottle, you won't regret it!

title: I LOVE this thiiiing!!
text: If you're unsure about buying this, I recommend you buy the smaller spray bottle and see how your skin reacts, it may become your favorite product as it became one of mine. I began noticing that healthy pink hue on  my skin, as well as fresh clean glow look the morning after using it (I sprayed it on after I wash and moisturize my face and some times as a make up setting spray). My skin has changed due to age and a particular health condition  that has made my skin a bit dryer and sometimes flaky, I'd noticed then that I was missing something, as my usual skin products were not enough to keep up with the changes. I found this on a list of high rated Amazon products and I'm definitely one more very satisfied buyer. I've been using it every day for months now and I'm definitely making it a must have at all times staple product. Give it a try, it's well worthy!!

title: Propylene glycol?! Will not use even once.
text:
The 2nd ingredient is propylene glycol! They should have the list of ingredients in the product description so that people know what's in it before they purchase, instead of posting the ingredient label as a photo that might not get looked at. I will be sending this back for a refund. I refuse to spritz my face with propylene glycol.

For those of you who don't know, propylene glycol is a chemical created as a byproduct of petroleum refining (meaning it comes from the same stuff that oil and gasoline are made of). According to the Material Safety Data Sheet on propylene glycol, the chemical is a strong skin irritant, and has been implicated in contact dermatitis. The sheet goes on to warn that the ingredient can inhibit skin cell growth and damage cell membranes, causing rashes, dry skin, and surface damage. No thanks!

title: UPDATED review. Keep looking!
text:
UPDATE: 2nd Purchase-

Gross! It left a tacky residue. MB customer service confirmed authenticity. They said they ship directly to Amazon, but product guarantees are only for purchases through mariobadescu.com.

I told them about the residue and was told, “I don’t know what to say about it.” Hard pass on this.
———-

This is a rare product that hasn’t caused redness, burning, and breakouts. It’s perfect for parched skin while traveling and during the dry winter months. I use 2-3 spritzes after washing my face and during the day. It gives that little bit of necessary moisture to keep fresh while keeping oily skin in check.

text:
had heard a lot about these and know Mario Badescu to be a quality brand, so I decided to buy these on prime day.

I'm not super impressed. I kept the rosewater spray in my purse. I would use it to set makeup or for a midday pick-me-up. Some days it was alright but others I felt like all it did was make my skin super oily and greasy(I have combination skin). It did not act well with my makeup. Eventually, the bottle cap somehow got loosened in my bag and most of the product leaked out. I know this can happen with any product,

I have kept the green bottle in my bathroom and use it after I was my face. It's refreshing and I enjoy it...but I don't think this is a necessary product you need to have in your skin care arsenal. I probably won't buy again.

title: Pending results
text:
I am starting off with three stars because I have just now used it today.
Product was shipped quickly and I quickly got emails from seller asking if I got the package and if it works s for me.
So far I don't know if it works, but I have sprayed it along the edge line of my roof and on the trees closest to my house.
You have to prime the spray by just squeezing he nozzle. This is a turn off for me. I rather have a push pump or just a battery operated nozzle that pulls the product out. I've had to stop and prime it at least 5 times just going around the roof line with it.
Product smells clean and natural, which is great since I will also be using this inside my house for mice.
I live in a steel building and am woken up by what seems like a fight club for squirrels every morning and every time I try to nap. Really hope this product works so I don't have to take my methods to the next level.

title: Good product, especially for people with sensitive skin!
text:
As someone with sensitive skin, I was pleased that this was made with all natural products.

I began to feel results after a day, mostly on my face and scalp (since it said you can use on these areas). My skin wasn't dry and itchy and my scalp stopped itching. The oil on my face cleared up within hours and my forehead doesn't feel oily. The redness in my cheeks as reduced too, cooling my face.

My hair softened upon using this for two days. Even though I use Biolage for my hair, this not only made my hair smell good but gave it a little more bounce to the ends. This was something I did not expect, but a good side effect.

One important reason I continued to use this was because the smell did not give me a headache. Most products are sensitive by feel and smell for me. To see that my cats did not recoil at the smell of it on my hands pleased me.

I will be purchasing this product again :)

title: Excellent product, a powerful help with Psoriasis
text:
I suffer of Psoriasis, a skin condition that causes some flaking and red skin. It is very annoying and embarrassing.
To keep the drying and flaking under control, the key is moisture.
I have been using different methods and products, and with the face being so delicate, so far what worked the best for me was Vaseline. but my face ended up feeling very greasy.
I discovered this product by accident, and it has been miraculous!!! I just spray two splashes in my face before leaving home, and that is just enough to keep my face moisturized for the whole day!!! I still cannot believe it. The fragance of rose, which is very feminine, disappears within minutes, so no worries my boys, you can wear it without feeling girly!

Overall, I am veryyyyyyy happy with this!

title: BEST FACIAL SPRAY EVER
text:
So I recently purchased this product from Urban Outfitters because I love Mario Badescu's products.
My skin is incredibly dry sometimes where it'll peel or if I don't put a moisturizer on my skin will feel tight and just gross.
Though, with this product, right after I wash my face and my skin starts to feel dry and tight I just spritz a little of this over my face and my skin feels incredibly hydrated. I feel no tightness at all.
I also get a few pimples here and there and this product has not made me break out once. I actually think it helps with acne.
But anyways! GET THIS PRODUCT! IT IS AMAZING!!!
Tip: pop this in the fridge and then once it gets cool just spray it on and it is sooooo refreshing.

title: Great for calming skin
text: I have tried at least 6 other facial sprays from witch hazel to thermal spring water and I believe the Mario Badescu facial spray is the best. I have tried other rosewater sprays, but found they do not help with the redness and calming of my skin as much as this one does. I think it is due to the aloe and other extra herbs in this product that separates it from the rest of the facial sprays. I wash my face with a foaming cleanser to prevent irritating any breakouts I have and then apply my Thayer's Witch Hazel Toner (Alcohol Free Toner so my skin isn't stripped of moisture). After using toner I then moisturize and use this facial spray. Sometimes I use the facial spray before and after I moisturize. For the price I think there is a great amount of product and the mist is fine and doesn't squirt and attack your face with a lot of product. I carry the travel size container in my purse and mist my face throughout the day for a little pick me up. Do I think this product has completely transformed my skin? No, but I do think it has helped my skin look healthier and has helped to even out the redness in my skin.

In an effort to see if it’s just my skin chemistry that it conflicts with,  I had a couple of other people try the product. I did not tell them what I didn’t like about it and yet they had the same feedback which indicates to me, it is the product.  Maybe it’s just this bottle? Possibly exposed to heat or cold that changed the integrity of it? I don’t know but what I do know is that the company does not offer a refund, an alternative or a solution.

title: it really is a great pick me up during a long day
text: I picked this up because of  all the rave reviews, but I was rather indifferent to it in the beginning.  Mostly because I wasn't sure what it was suppose to do (facial spray?  could you get anymore general).  However, it's really grown on me over the past few months I've been using it.  it really is a great pick me up during a long day.  I used it at work in the winter when my skin was dull an flaky, and in the summer its an excellent light moisturizer (I find cream based cleanser are too heavy in humid summer weather).  Also, it acts a nice base and finisher to my makeup routine.  It's got a bit thicker than pure water, and has a slight stickiness when it's first applied.  It absorbs within a couple minutes though, leaving you face dry and refreshed.  I don't use it every day, but it has become a fairly regular product in my skin care routine.  I would definitely recommend picking up the travel size to try out.

title: one of my favorite beauty products
text:
This is the greatest. I fly often so I bought this with the intention of spritzing during/after a long flight. I never got around to putting it in a <3oz bottle but whatever. Chicago winters are brutal on my skin so I need all hands on deck. I put this on before bed (after a facial oil, intense moisturizer, the whole shebang) and my skin doesn't feel complete without it. It smells so nice too. I also spritz during the day when I'm feeling a little dry but too lazy to put on lotion. I'm also more comfortable with spraying this while wearing makeup than I would be with applying a full on moisturizer.

I've also tried a L'Occitane facial spray, but this one is so much better. I'm not opposed to trying other brands, but this stuff is so good I won't need to.

title: NEW FORMULA, DO NOT BUY
text:
They changed the formula majorly since all of these awesome reviews. Before the ingredients were:

Deionized Water (Aqua),Aloe (Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice) Vera Gel,Bladderwrack (Fucus Vesiculous) Extract,Herbal Extract,Rose (Rosa Gallica) Extract,Gardenia (Gardenis Florida) Extract,Propylene Glycol.

The new ingredients are:
Aqua (Water,Eau),Propylene Glycol,Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice,Rosa Canina Extract,Thymus Vulgaris (Thyme) Leaf Extract,Fucus Vesiculosus Extract,Gardenia Florida Fruit Extract,Caprylyl Glycol,Hexylene Glycol,Polysorbate 20,Parfum (Fragrance),Phenoxyethanol,Sodium Chloride,Citronellol,Geraniol,CI 17200 (Red 33),CI 42090 (Blue 1)

They've added way more of the glycols, propylene glycol used to be the last ingredient and now it's second, which is room for concern (glycols are alcohols and alcohols are drying), and now ethanol is in it (an even worse alcohol). Ethanol makes products quickly dry which makes them feel weightless on the skin for cheap... HOWEVER, ethanol causes irritation to the skin and is bad for ALL skin types, which you will see if you buy this product. Just do a google search and see for yourself. Some alcohols are okay, but not ethanol! I have very clear skin and never have bad breakouts. My skin is not sensitive and I really never worry about using anything on it because it's just rarely an issue. The day after I used this I had a terrible breakout, worse than any other skin product ever has. I'm really disappointed and wish I could get my hands on the old formula that everyone loved so much.

title: Has red 33 in it and BLUE 1?!
text: Upon receiving this product, I immediately regretted not reading all of the ingredients previous to purchasing it. While red 33 is common in cosmetics and is FDA approved, it is still derived from petroleum and coal. Because of this, I consider it to be unsafe for human consumption, even on the skin. And, the fact that it contains BLUE 1 is baffling to me, considering the fact that it is the least recommended dye to put on skin because it causes the most irritation. BLUE 1 is also known to cause nerve damage and asthma, among other health problems. Unfortunately, I do not recommend this for a part of anybody skin routine. It's just not worth the risk.

title: Winter can't beat me!
text:
Dry skin? Rosewater spray. Frizzy hair? Rosewater spray. Boyfriend acting up? Rosewater spray.

Let me start by saying I have dryyyyy skin. I have the kind of skin that flakes and bleeds, especially in the winter. I try to look for natural products the best I can, but not to the point where I'm like a hippie or anything so please don't throw rocks at me if my products aren't straight from the earth. :(

I moisturize every night with a homemade whipped shea butter and almond oil lotion. It's very moisturizing but obviously not for the daytime because it's on the heavier side (I like my face to feel like it's getting a treatment overnight!).

During the day, I use Cetaphil's face lotion with SPF. It's moisturizing, but of course it's not going to be like a night cream! So if you ever need a pick me up... MARIO BADEACU ROSEWATER SPRAY TO THE RESCUE! It has aloe in it and smells like roses. I just give my face a spritz and I instantly feel my skin perk up. It's not greasy, just moisturizing. I've gotten so many of my friends and family obsessed with this stuff. I have a bottle on my bathroom counter and one in my purse for on the go. I've even used it to spray on my hair if I'm out in public and my hair is a frizzy mess!

Don't believe the hype? My husband keeps a bottle in his toiletry bag. Yes, he's in the army. :)

Excellent product, which would be dramatically improved by using a glass spray bottle that actually worked!

title: On the fence
text: This rosewater mist with aloe vera and other natural ingredients works well, but according to the EWG (environmental working group) it is not as natural as other brands. I always tell people to download the EWG app because you can put in different foods, household products, and personal care products, and it will tell you a rating that the item is EWG verified, or its concern for cancer, environmental and allergy reactions by reading it from a number 1 (safest) to 8 (high toxicity) being a cancer survivor, I will only purchase items that are EWG verified, or are rated a one or two. On the app I believe this is rated at three or four.

title: Yas - Kween - you need it.
text:
It's rare that I write a review for a product I order from Amazon. But I got this as an add-on item in the 4oz size after seeing it suggested while shopping for sunscreen. I love this product, I immediately incorporated it into my skin care routine and it has now become a staple. Not only does it smell delightful and hydrate my skin, it makes my hair incredibly soft. I use extensions and I spray them with a little bit of this before I brush them out and they remain so soft and shiny, as does my natural hair.

I just reordered the product in the 8 oz container, the combination of aloe, rosewater, and herbs is probably my favorite thing right now in terms of beauty. Other rosewater sprays don't offer this combination of ingredients.

I would not recommend using it to set makeup - the way it disperses from the pump is much thicker and not as uniform as the fine mist you would require for even coverage. I use this product prior to putting on makeup or fixing my hair - I soak my freaking face it in and it makes my skin so soft.

title: This is one of my favorites
text:
I have really sensitive combination skin and I really do like this product. I used it as a toner after washing my face or as a way to refresh my face throughout the day.* The smell is pleasant and refreshing, but I happen to like how roses smell. What I really enjoyed about this facial spray is how it leaves your skin feeling moisturized, some other toners/sprays leave my skin feeling stripped or dried out. I really wish the bottle had a better spray pump so it would be more like a mist, but overall it is a great product.

*I must add that I don’t wear make up on the daily so I have never sprayed this on top of foundation.

title: Gentle spray for sensitive combo/acne prone skin
text:
Age: mid-twenties
My skin type: combination/acne prone
I purchased this spray about a month ago and have been using it twice daily. I will spritz it on my face several times after showering and massage it gently into my skin. I give it a couple of minutes to sink in before adding my moisturizer on top (Mario Badescu Seaweed Night Cream- also a loved product!). I also use it in the morning, but only with 1-2 sprays. I'll have to admit, I was a skeptic when purchasing this product, but I knew I would be traveling a lot and I was concerned about the effects of airplane air, as well as exposing my skin to frequent changes in weather. Since using this spray, I've noticed that my skin tone is much more even, my skin feels smoother and more supple, and what really surprised me is that my breakouts have reduced in frequency and severity. I've used about a third of the bottle in the time that I've had it (~1 month). I also appreciate that the scent doesn't linger and that it doesn't bother my sensitive eyes, however, it does have a bitter taste if you happen to get some on your lips. I also don't generally wear a full face of makeup, but I've never had any issues with my concealer/blush/bronzer when used in conjunction with this product. I love this product and will definitely repurchase-- especially at a fraction of the cost of other facial sprays!

The first thing I noticed when using it was the lovely scent of roses, which is refreshing and invigorating. The spray itself is very lightweight and absorbs into the skin quickly, leaving a smooth and hydrated finish.

One of the things I love about this product is its versatility. I use it as a toner, a makeup setting spray, and just to refresh my skin throughout the day. The aloe in the formula is great for calming and soothing any irritation or redness on the skin, and it works well on all skin types.

Overall, I highly recommend the Rosewater Facial Spray with Aloe to anyone looking for a lightweight, hydrating, and refreshing skincare product. It's a great addition to any skincare routine and leaves your skin feeling and smelling great.

title: Desert Dweller's Must Have!
text:
This is so perfect for Arizona!
The temperatures get 115 here easily and it is brutal. I needed something for the days that I am stuck outside in the heat. This is perfect. First, it is small enough to easily fit into a purse. Second, the combination of aloe and rosewater can really help sooth skin and stave off a sunburn. It is light enough that women with oily skin don't have to worry about it clogging your pores. It can be used to set makeup, but I don't wear makeup so I can't comment on that. It also smells amazing and tastes good on your skin (like roses). I usually have a couple of sprays and I am good. It has lasted a while for me and I use it daily. The price is defiantly right and every woman I have loaned this too on a hot day has demanded to know where I purchased it.

title: Worth every penny
text:
For those who are new to Facial mists

1. A huge craze going back in Asia to keep skin hydrated, women use this mid day to retain the moisture on skin
2. You could use it mid day like fellow Asians, use it before Make up as setting base, after make, or during long flights, especially if you don't want to use that flight water on face yuck !!
3. If you are thinking that it looks like water and will melt down your make up you can't be more wrong. The consistency is heavier than water possibly due to Aloe in it and as soon as you spray it will feel like rain drops on your face give it few minutes and your face will dry leaving you feeling fresh. Some people suggest dabbing it with your fingertips, I don't unless you've washed your hands and don't have any make up, dabbing will mess your make up
4. If you guys are thinking about the cost then let me tell you, for any facial mist the cost will depend on ingredients, the more natural they are the expensive the product. The higher end facial mists have Green tea, snail secretion and other stuff. This one is just not bad with aloe and rosewater
5. It does have rose smell for those who dislike it this is not for you, as smell lingers for some time
6. The cost in actual Ulta store is pretty much the same give and take one penny

title: Irritated my skin and works terrible to "refresh"
text: I should have loved this product: rave reviews, cult product, and I love a good mist.  But this product made my skin BURN like no other.  I have odd sensitive skin - Cetaphil products are actually quite irritating for me, lots of "light" "hypo-allergenic" face moisturizers tend to burn and lead to patches of red irritation on my skin.  But my no means am I sensitive to most or all products.  Whether I used this as a mist after washing my face or to set my makeup, it did nothing but irritate and burn my skin.  Plus - when I attempted to use it as a mid-day refresher, it did the exact opposite.  My skin felt DRYER and TIGHTER after spraying even the lightest mist.  Awful product.  My suspicion is the use of alcohol in this product.  So terrible.  You are better off with a true rosewater spray.  I had been using pure rosewater to tone my skin after washing and have only had the best results.

title: Ingredients changed
text: Recently I’ve changed my entire skincare products to be completely natural and was disappointed to see this bottle with chemicals and artificial dyes. You can see from other reviews’ photos that there’s a difference between the listed ingredients. I had enjoyed using this product but have discontinued it in my routine because I have sensitive skin and don’t want to risk having a bad reaction to the new ingredients. Instead, I’ve enjoyed using Thayer’s witch hazel and real rose water for toners.

I think this product works. Just not for me.

title: CLEARED MY CYSTIC ACNE
text: Wow... sooo I had clear skin in HS but then started gettinf cystic acne along the left and right sides of my face! Horrible, red, irritated acne. I tried everything. Just TWO days ago, I started using this spray all over my face, and I kid you not, my skin has cleared up immensely. I’m still amazed and I’m just waiting for something bad to happen, because I just can’t believe how fast it’s helped. It’s not even recommended for acne, but I highly highly recommend for anyone suffering from cystic acne. LOVE

title: Calming and hydrating
text: This facial spray is so refreshing and has become a staple in my everyday skincare routine. Along with my makeup primer, I love the way my makeup applies after using this spray. I let it fully dry before applying makeup. Sometimes I also spray on top of my make up to set it and that seems to work pretty well. This is the last thing I put on my face before i go to bed, and it's really relaxing. My skin feels very hydrated in the mornings. For the price, and with as many uses as this product has, I cant find anything comparable.

title: Flying like a lady

Or possibly the slight hint of rose that takes you back to early spring mornings in mum's garden. It is a perfect way to pamper your skin before bed, and again when you wake up without overwhelming it. I combine this with a coconut butter application before bed and it truly has saved my dry skin from this intense winter season. If you want to have a first class red eye experience, Mario Badescu is all you need to get ready for your day.

title: So much yes
text: Products rarely work for my skin in the winter. My skin is so dry and flaky that I pretty much have just come to terms with my makeup being cakey and flakey and my skin being tight and dry no matter what miracle products I used during our dry winter months here. Until this stuff. I originally bought it for my daughter for a stocking stuffer. I used it one night before my moisturizer. The next morning my face was so soft. I thought I was just having a good skin day. So I spritzed it on again before my daily moisturizer. All day long my skin stayed moisturized. I spritz it on after my serums and before my moisturizer. It is AMAZING. I bought more because it really lives up to it's hype. At least for me. I will use this every single winter from now on. And it's incredibly refreshing and the scent is so earthy and beautiful.

title: NOT dermatologist recommended

I had been using Lush’s rose water spray and when I was unable to find it following the covid pandemic, read an article that suggested this spray. While I didn’t mind it, it was a little tacky (in feeling) and I noticed after prolong use my face was drying out in patches like never before - I have not ever had dry skin or patches! Apparently this product is awful for you. It dries out your skin and is loaded up with unnecessary fragrant perfumes that destroy your skin. You pay for what you get I guess!

title: Picked this up randomly because it had good reviews and I needed a minimum purchase amount
text:
This was a game-changer. Picked this up randomly because it had good reviews and I needed a minimum purchase amount. Surprised to find that I love this! It's light and refreshing and moisturizes my skin.

I have combination skin that is prone to breakout with heavy moisturizers. But a lot of the time, my cheeks are left dry after washing my face. I use this every day after I wash my face at night, sometimes in the morning before putting on my makeup. It has a light rose scent, which I really enjoy, but those who are sensitive to smells may find this overpowering. It's great at prepping my skin so that my foundation doesn't leave flakes or dry patches on my face.

I got my roommate a bottle, and she loves it too. Will definitely repurchase when I run out!

title: Pleasant and refreshing
text: I saw this in an Urban Outfitters and tried it. So, I went on amazon and bought it. This was the first facial mist I ever bought. I really like it. I put on bb cream and foundation, and I don't like when it looks too thick or cakey. I like to spray this on as a makeup setter, and it makes my base makeup feel thinner and lighter. It smells really nice and it feels refreshing. I really love the smell of rosewater. I also spray it on throughout the day. When I feel tired or my skin feels heavy, I spray it on, and it helps. I bought a smaller travel spray bottle and filled it with this to carry it around with me in my backpack. I totally recommend it. It's quite natural. It's simple and basic, compared to other facial mists that have SPF or whitening. This one is pleasant and refreshing.

title: risky chemicals in this product!
text:
I tried this product because of all the recent hype. THIS PRODUCT MADE ME BREAK OUT IN HIVES, especially around my eyes. My skin is extremely dry now and burns to the touch. On top of that, it made my makeup very cakey, my skin look wrinkley, and my face feel tight and dehydrated.

The SECOND ingredient is propylene glycol, a small organic alcohol commonly used as a skin conditioning agent. This ingredient is a skin irritant and known to cause allergic contact dermatitis as well as contact urticaria (rash) in humans; these sensitization effects can be manifested at propylene glycol concentrations as low as 2%. Since this is the second ingredient, the concentration is likely more than 2% and probably why it did such significant damage to my skin. Be very cautious when using this product!!!

Lastly, the fragrance and dye are skin irritants and I'm just really disappointed in this product. Having sensitive skin sucks and I had high hopes for this product. Still searching for a true rose water spray without all the risky chemicals.
