title: If you're sensitive to smells, just stay away
text: I originally purchased this since it was hyped on YouTube, and I wanted to find a cheaper alternative to my MAC fix plus. I wish I had just gotten the MAC fix plus. Comparably, it doesn't set my makeup as nicely. Basically it does an average job. However, that's not why I don't like it. I can't stand the smell. Even though it's a rose smell, honestly it kind of smell likes an old perfume. Eventually the smell does go away, but I'm not sure if that's because I had just gotten used to it. Because I don't want this smell on me I find myself never wearing it. For a cheaper alternative I've been going with the Elf spray. The one thing this product does have going for me is that it has the best nozzle out of all the makeup sprays I have. The mist is fine and I don't have to worry about my makeup melting away when I accidentally spray too much or too closely. I'd actually like to reuse the bottle, if I wasn't so worried about the smell...

title: I'm Hooked
text: I have dry skin, especially during the winter. I came across this product almost three years ago and have used it ever since. I keep a bottle at home and work, and another travel size in my purse. I spritz my face 5-6 times a day, maybe more. First time is in the morning after I wash my face and before I slap on moisturizer. I spray my face and let it dry before adding light make-up, and spritz again to set the make up once I'm dolled up. I am married, but for you single women trying to find your soul mate, here's a helpful hint. People search for kissable partners and women wearing noticiable make-up is a huge turn off. Taste your foundation or face powder to understand why. It is unpleasant, and transfers to the taste buds while kissing. Instead of packing on more make-up, I freshen my face 2-3 times during the day with a few squirts of this product. It does not remove the make-up I applied hours before, and once this product dries and absorbs into my pours, it does not leave a yucky, perfuming residue. After a heavy workout or coming in from a terribly hot day, just a couple of pumps of this product over my face and drinking water is all I need to cool down fast. I get monthly facials and my Esthetician sense my dry skin, however, she commented on how well I keep my face hydrated and wanted to know the product I use. I text her a picture of this product and she's been recommending it to her clients since. Having terribly dry skin ages a woman fast. With lack of moisture, too much sun exposure and wearing heavy make up can make women my age look ten years older, even moreso with bad eating and sleeping habits, lack of water intake and smoking. Although, genetics contributes to my youthful appearance, maintaining proper care of my body and skin keeps me looking years younger than I actually am. A picture is worth a 1000 words and the picture shared was taken of me last Jan., 2016. It's cropped, but not altered or taken with special camera effects. It's just me enjoying an evening out with my friends. I am 46 years old.

title: Parfum, red and blue dye
text: I love rosewater products. I have tried this one and haven’t been loving. My skin is very sensitive. I was naive to think all rosewater has natural ingredients. This one has red, blue and parfum. All of which I cannot handle on my face. It’s a spray and even if you close your mouth and eyes, some will get in your body. Inhaled red is very toxic. Just something to think about when you’re buying products that go on as a “tonic” to your skin. I bought a different one that just has rosewater. Don’t make my mistake. Buy a better product. One that doesn’t need to be colored or perfumed.

title: Comparison between Thayer's Rosewater
text:
I ran out of Thayer's while I was traveling, so I went to ULTA to look for an alternative. Buying the product at ULTA is great because they usually have a $3.50 off $10 or $5 off $15 coupon all the time.

This is a comparison

INGREDIENTS
- Mario Badescu: Aqua (Water, Eau), Propylene Glycol, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Rosa Canina Extract, Thymus Vulgaris (Thyme) Leaf Extract, Fucus Vesiculosus Extract, Gardenia Florida Fruit Extract, Caprylyl Glycol, Hexylene Glycol, Polysorbate 20, Parfum (Fragrance), Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Chloride, Citronellol, Geraniol, CI 17200 (Red 33), CI 42090 (Blue 1)
- Thayer's: Purified Water, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice (Certified Organic Filet Of Aloe Vera), Glycerin (Vegetable), Fragrance (Natural Rose), Hamamelis Virginiana Extract (made from Certified Organic Witch Hazel), Rosa Centifolia (Rose) Flower Water, Citric Acid, Citrus Grandis (Grapefruit) Seed Extract

PERFORMANCE
- Toner: I feel Thayer's is more moisturizing than Mario Badescu. I actually feel like my face is dryer using MB, so I tend to use more.
- Makeup Setting Spray: MB sets my makeup fine. Thayer's seems to set my makeup with more moisture.
- Facial Mist: Both work fine for touch up misting throughout the day when my face either feels oily or dry. Prefer Thayer's for moisture, but feel MB is nice when I want a lighter mist.
- Hair Mist: My hair is too coarse and wavy that I don't see a difference using either as a hair mist.

APPLICATION
- Mario Badescu: The spray pump is okay. I would prefer to transfer it into a nicer spray bottle.
- Thayer's: Comes in a squeeze bottle that's easy to transfer to any spray bottle, but the bottle can leak if you have the older version.

PACKAGE
- Mario Badescu: Comes in a frosted plastic bottle with a plastic spray with a paper label. Comes in a smaller, portable size too.
- Thayer's: Comes in a glossy bottle with a plastic lid. Not very portable. Usually you transfer the rosewater to a different bottle.
- Side Note: I prefer using glass bottles with metal sprays, so that's where I find MB's spray bottle unnecessary.

PRICE
- Mario Badescu: $12 for 8oz ($1.50/oz)
- Thayer's: $10 for 12oz ($0.83/oz)

OVERALL
I would go with Thayer's, especially if you have really dry skin like me. You also get a lot more for your money.

title: Best stuff  E V E R
text:
Ok. So I bought this, fell in love with it, ran out, bought something similar (I'm a try-aholic), and nothing comes close to this.
I do my makeup daily for work, and I use this once I get out of the shower before my skincare routine. I put on my makeup, sometimes spritzing my brush to help blend my foundation. I spray after my makeup, completely forgoing any of the usual expensive setting sprays. I keep a bottle of this stuff in my purse and it helps since I live in a hot sticky climate. Even when it's cold, this is a guilt free spritz of goodness, because it instantly moisturizes my face, refreshing it with no bad run ins with my makeup. Every time I go back to my dear beloved Mario, I wonder why I even kept trying other things. The smell is adorable and reminds me of my grandmother, but it's rose-scented (obviously), so it's a classic natural scent. It isn't overpowering at all and omg I can't think of enough good things to say about this!

title: I was extremely disappointed to find that this product has propylene glycol in ...
text:
I was extremely disappointed to find that this product has propylene glycol in it. I found this article online about it on THEGOODHUMAN>COM.:

"What is propylene glycol? It is is a chemical found in personal care products that acts as a penetration enhancer that keeps products from melting in heat and/or freezing when it is cold. It is found in items such as shampoo, conditioner, soap, acne treatment, moisturizer, toothpaste, deodorant, nail polish, mascara; basically anything you could possibly use on your body, propylene glycol is in it. But why should you avoid propylene glycol?

For starters it alters the structure of the skin by allowing chemicals to penetrate deep beneath it while increasing their ability to reach the blood stream. Sounds lovely, right? So even if propylene glycol was good for you, it’s main job is to help any other chemicals you come in contact with reach your bloodstream. Who wants to use a chemical designed to help other chemicals penetrate even deeper into your skin? Not me.

However, there is even more to it than just that…
How Toxic is Propylene Glycol

According to the Environmental Working Group, propylene glycol can cause a whole host of problems. It is rated a 3 by them, which is categorized as a “moderate” health issue. It has been shown to be linked to cancer, developmental/reproductive issues, allergies/immunotoxicity, neurotoxicity, endocrine disruption, and organ system toxicity. It has been found to provoke skin irritation and sensitization in humans as low as 2% concentration, while the industry review panel recommends cosmetics can contain up to 50% of the substance. It has also been classified as “expected to be toxic or harmful” by Environment Canada.
How to Spot Propylene Glycol

When looking at ingredient lists, you can look for names like 1,2-Dihydroxypropane; 2-Hydroxypropanol; Methylethy Glycol; 1,2-Propanediol; Propane-1,2-Diol. Some popular products that contain propylene glycol include:

Biolage by Matrix Conditioning Balm
Nivea for Men Hair & Body Wash, Sensitive
Aveeno Active Naturals Skin Relief Overnight Cream
Arm & Hammer Essentials Natural Deodorant, Unscented
Cetaphil Daily Facial Moisturizer For All Skin Types

So take a look at the ingredients of the products that you use and search for propylene glycol or the other names it is often called/listed as. I try my best to only use safe, natural products, but I am always reading labels in the store before I purchase anything. Chances are there is a safe alternative to a toxic favorite. Next time you are shopping for a personal care item, be sure to remember what propylene glycol is and do your best to avoid it!"

title: Wow!
text:
Ok. I heard about Mario Badescu products from Youtube beauty/make up artist Jaclyn Hill and decided to try it on a whim. First of all, the order was delivered very fast which is awesome. But besides just the spray, the box contained a bunch of generously sized samples including hand cream, facial moisturizer, and body wash. I am in LOVE with the hand cream and will be purchasing a full sized bottle.

The spray has such a light and refreshing scent, if you like the smell of roses you will not be disappointed. According to the bottle it can be used on your face, neck, and hair, and to set your make up. Now, as far as setting your make up goes, it definitely works as long as you don't spray too heavily. In fact, if you over do it with the spray, your make up is going to run right off. I used two light spritzes and my make up lasted all day and night. When used just for a burst of moisture on a clean face, I have to say it is very refreshing and leaves my skin feeling super hydrated.

Overall I am very happy with my purchase and am looking forward to trying out more Mario Badescu products.

text: I am not a hippie dippy “omgz it has CHEMICALZZZ” kind of person because, well - everything is chemicals. Sooo anyway... to me, this rose water spray is amazing. I was skeptical about what I thought was overpriced perfumed water but this stuff is legit. I buy a ton of skincare stuff and am not easily sold on the claimed benefits. While this is not some holy grail catch-all fix for problematic skin... it is very refreshing and in my experience has helped keep my skin at bay. Sometimes (okay maybe most days!) I’m too lazy and tired to do my full routine so I know that this has helped to keep my acne prone, oily skin at bay because I usually always incorporate it. It also gives a really nice glowy finish to your skin if you spritz yourself after doing your makeup. Love it as a pick me up as well, but that’s more of an emotional benefit. Would recommend for sure.

title: would definitely buy again!

I also have pretty sensitive skin and typically have a reaction to products like this (e.g. toners, facial sprays), but this is so gentle on the skin that it doesn't bother me at all. I would definitely recommend this to someone looking for a new facial product.

title: Feels good if u believe
text: I'm not sure any rose spray really does anything noticeable for your complexion, but something about a light, cool mist on your face sure does feel good. Then again plain water can give me the same feeling. This product, however, has a nicer fragrance than plain H2O and leaves a silky, albeit slightly sticky, film of moisture on your skin that feels hydrating. The film sinks into your skin rather quickly and the cool softness lasts only a few moments longer. The sprayer is simple, but efficient in delivering a light mist. It does not spray a super fine mist, but it is light enough. This, I suspect, is because the supplied bottle is a rather ordinary one. My daughter and I don't mind that. We actually think the simplicity of the bottle is cute. So if you believe the touts of rose water as a youth preserving elixir, this one would be about as good as any and at a competive price.

title: More of a pamper, but not a miracle worker
text: I have to be honest I've seen a lot of amazing reviews of this product and I was a little skeptical.. I used about half of the smallest bottle in about 2 months, I haven't seen a drastic change in my skin or anything but It's for sure really refreshing on my skin and makes me look glowy. I don't recommend using it over makeup like a setting spray however unless you just have concealer or cream products . How I use it: I wash my hair every other day and this is when I like to use it because it's more of a pamper for me. I get out the shower and I spray this over my face twice and moisturize my skin with a normal face moisturizer and then I spray this all on my face, neck, and chest. It feels super refreshing and gives a little nice tingly feeling. so although it hasn't changed my skin for better or worse I still enjoy using it because it feels nice on the skin.

text: I was excited about this product, but disappointed once received.  It contains parfum (fragrance) and also synthetic coloring CI 17200 (Red 33), and CI 42090 (Blue 1), and I was hoping for more of a natural product.  Should have read the ingredients prior to purchase.  I gave 2 stars; however, because if those things aren't an issue for you, it appears to be a nice product, hydrating, and smells nice (albeit from parfum). MB, please consider removing the coloring.  It doesn't add anything to the product, and quite honestly, I get you're trying to simulate a "rose" color, but considering that the color is not from ACTUAL roses, don't think your consumer would care if the product were clear.

Try this facial spray as a little skin treat for yourself!

I purchased this product because I was hoping it could replace my mineral water mist without having to put cream or oil right after. It doesn't dry my skin as much as a regular mineral water mist but I have to moisturize (a bit) my skin (at some point) after, although I feel much less irritated than with simple water. But in the rest I really like the effect it does so I prevent it from falling into my eyes and I better apply an aloe gel, I think the version of this splay in rose water is not so much for me so I will buy the one of Aloe, I'm sure that will work much better for my whole face.
It is not much product so if you are going to use it every day several times you will realize that it ends quickly so I recommend that you buy a larger boat if you want to always use it. No doubt the product packaging can improve, because it only has one bag that could prevent the spilled product from spilling even more. So they should improve the packaging. But if the product does not arrive spilled in general it looks very beautiful and is very good. I love this brand. I will buy these products again in the version that is best for my skin.

title: May as well be water in a bottle, stop listening to YT gurus
text: This product is very, very overhyped. My only pro is that it helped me realize that I was allergic to hexylene glycol. Aside from that, it may as well just be water in a bottle with a debatable "okay" smell. It barely provides any moisture, if any at all. Stop listening to these youtube gurus and random skincare people on twitter. The only thing this product does is look good on a shelf and in pictures. It will not clear your acne (I did not expect it to, but others do). You're better off trying giant bottles of asian hydrating toners and putting them in spray bottles, it'll last you at LEAST six months, if not a year. I recommend Kikumasamune High Moist Lotion. You get 500 mL for $12. 500 mL would be about 5 times the size of this for only $5 more.

At first, I didn't think nothing of it because my face gets frequent pimples every once in a while. I tried this product another time and got the same pimple situation. This was a serious problem. My face never had this many pimples in one area. Finally, I did my makeup without the product to see if my breakout was the result of something else, turns out my makeup wasn't the problem, it was the facial spray.

title: Propylene Glycol??
text: I was surprised to see Propylene Glycol listed as the second ingredient after Aqua or water.  With common listed side effects of nausea and vomiting (Propylene Glycol material safety data sheet).  I understand it is FDA approved to use as an agent to absorb extra water for cosmetics however it is also used for antifreeze (more common may be ethylene glycol).  Along with Phenoxyethanal, Caprylyl glycol, and other ingredients I need to look up - I discarded the bottle for something with more natural and sustainable ingredients.

title: This made my skin break out in eczema or some kind of rash...
text:
I've sprayed rose water on my face before (a different, much cheaper brand).
My face responded well to it.

I sprayed this on my face in the morning, and by afternoon I had the worst eczema I've ever experienced on my face.
Very red, scaly, and VERY much burning and itching.

I'm almost certain it has to be this product, since it's really the only thing different I did the day I used it.

Maybe it's one of the many non-essential ingredients I see in the ingredient list, such as food coloring and fragrance.

title: Personal Review
text:
What are the pros and cons?

Affordable
Hydrate my skin without making it feel greasy but gives me a visible glow
Makes my makeup apply beautifully
Doesn’t irritate my skin
Refreshing during the day and relaxing at night
The spray is great! Not too misty, not too heavy
I honestly can’t think of any setbacks. However, if you’re looking for an ultra-glowy spray or a long-wear makeup spray, keep looking. These give the skin a natural dewy appearance as opposed to a highlight-like sheen or shimmer. They won’t make your makeup last longer (not in my experience), but they will make it meld and fuse with the skin for a more blended result.

title: SKIN IRRITATING
text: I unfortunately saw the hype around this product and fell for it. My favorite glam gurus used it and loved it. They spoke so highly of this product. But when I bought it and used it the first time, it was nice. But it’s been almost 2 weeks(i know, I really wanted to make this product work for me ) and my face is breaking out, and it doesn’t break out. I’m breaking out on places on my face that I never break out on, my skin is itchy and dry and really irritated. I slowly introduced this to my skin care routine. I even thought that at one point maybe the ingredients in my regular routine just don’t work with this. I had patience and  utilized the internet to see what I could do. And alas nothing helpful, and nothing good and my face got worse. I would like to make it clear that I do not have sensitive skin. Do your research about this brand before buying. Just because it failed for me, doesn’t mean it’ll fail for you. But to be fair I have it a chance I really tried but this brand failed. The ingredients are the best quality of what they could be. And I just don’t trust it. You can buy something much for gentler and kinder to your face for cheap, do not use this.

title: I really wanted to like this product, but it didn’t work for me.
text: I have other Mario Badescu products, so I was really hoping this product would work well for me, but sadly it didn’t. I have sensitive skin that gets oily in summer and dry in winter. I read plenty of reviews on this product and while most of them were positive, I noticed some that mentioned perfumes and break outs. Unfortunately that was the case for me. I don’t get break outs, usually it’s just a single zit every now and then but this product gave me lots of little red bumps all over my face only 2 days after use. I even stopped using it for a week and tried again to see if the breakouts were caused by something else, but I believe it was this product. I give it two stars because I did like the scent a lot, even though it smelled perfume-y. And the spray did make my face look moisturized and “dewy”, but only at the cost of breaking out. I think I’ll stick with other Mario Badescu products and keep this one out of rotation.

skin was flaking due to dryness (skin also felt “tight” in a dry way). For some idiotic reason I thought - “maybe I just need to spray more?” - which made it worse. I reapplied my face lotion and all was well.

Do not buy this product.

title: Listen up oily Gals/boys
text:
So.... I have personally bought this at an Ulta and I saw all of the negative reviews on here about the harsh chemicals they put in here. Let’s be straight, there is only ONE harsh chemical and there has been research done saying that it doesn’t cause any damaging effects to your skin. The chemical was only meant to preserve the organic ingredients included. Sometime having something TOO organic can actually cause harmful reactions to a lot of people. But anyways to my review.

This product is GREAT for my oily, big pores skin. It sprays on my face so gently and I especially love using it when it super hot outside. It keeps my skin refreshed and awake throughout the day. I also use it to set my makeup!! It has multiple purposes. I don’t know if a lot of the people complaining have very dry skin, but I can honestly say I love the way my skin looks. It keeps my skin looking glowing and it makes me look so youthful. I seriously recommend to the oily people out there!! It is perfect!! Seriously GET IT!!

title: Pretty disappointed with this purchase
text: Pretty disappointed with this purchase. I have been wanting to try this mist for quite some time, and decided to add it on to my order last minute, however when I received it, the cap was loosened and the bottle was greasy to the touch—(some product leaked)which made me hesitant to put it on my face. I decided to try anyways. I’m giving 2 stars because I liked the smell, and imagine it is refreshing, but I don’t see my self using it very often as the sprayer malfunctions. Rather than coming out as an even spray or mist, it mist from the top and comes out in big droplets from the bottom. The bottle claims to be able to be used as a setting spray, but with a nozzle like that my makeup looked splotchy afterwords. Like I said, I DID like the smell.

title: Hives!  On my face!
text:
This made my face break out in hives! I feel like I should mention that I have very tolerant skin. I have never had an allergic reaction on my face, and I’m so unfamiliar to skin allergies that I didn’t even realize what it was! This made me break out in hives, twice! I thought after the first time that it had been something else I was exposed to that day, but when I gave it another shot a week later, the same thing happened!

I’m going to assume whatever is in this is not natural and actually quite allergenic. Dissatisfied to say the least.

text: I purchased this because of all the great reviews for it.  I didn't have any issues with this, but I just don't use it that much personally.  I use facial oil to moisturize, and I don't wear foundation or powder, so I don't really find myself needing a refresher midday or anything.  I do like the way this smells so much though.  Sometimes I just spray it on my body which I actually think is a better use for it.  On my face, it kind of feels sticky.  A huge perk though is that it never made me breakout, and I have very sensitive skin.  I would recommend if you feel your face gets tight throughout the day, or if you just want a nice smelling body refresher.

I have an oily complexion and spraying this on my face doesn't do much to alleviate the issue. In fact, I've noticed my face appears dewier about 20 minutes after using the spray which isn't ideal for an oily gal. I probably won't buy another bottle of this but I'll keep using it as a perfume for now, fortunately it wasn't expensive.

title: I love toning mists since i have oily skin and live ...
text: I love toning mists since i have oily skin and live in Florida. Although I really love this product, I find the scent and potency a little too strong so I like to dilute it with distilled water and a tiny bit of witch hazel. One of the perks of this product is that applied lightly it can be used over make-up without messing up your foundation. Make sure and cover your eyes to prevent runny mascara and you have a nice midday hydration pick me up for your skin.

title: Five Stars

title: Found myself a new organic, non oily setting spray!
text:
As a quickie for those who don't want to read my long ass review I would like to say that I would definitely recommend this product! Worked for me and you can read the rest to see how:

I have oily and sensitive skin so this product being organic already reassured me that it wouldn't mess with the sensitive part of my skin. I sprayed some on my hand before putting it on my face to make sure I didn't have an allergic reaction. So far so good. The spray has a nice fragrance with first made me worry since again, sensitive skin and frangracy stuff do not go together, but again this spray proved otherwise. I used it as a primer, as some reviews pointed out that it could be used as such, and as the setting spray. It sprayed on nicely (after a few attempts without it getting in my eye or mouth) and first thing I thought of is how refreshing it was. It was surprisingly moisturizing. After a night of being out and about I got home to see if it held up and it did! My face felt moisturized the whole night and I didn't feel oily. It didn't make my face look oily either, but I did look dewy which was a plus because I don't like looking entirely matte I like the natural dewy look. title: It's Heaven in a spray bottle.
text:
Absolutely ADORE this stuff. I've even spritzed it in my hair a time or two, even if I don't need it simply for the amazing rose scent. If you ever wanted to feel like you're prancing through a rose garden without the thorns, allergies and bees, I don't think you could get much closer than this.

I used to use NYX's mattifying setting spray, but throughout the day I noticed it would make my forehead look cakey and like the Sahara Desert despite putting hardly any makeup on. A friend of mine let me use hers once and I fell in love. Not only for the AMAZING scent, but it sets my makeup perfectly and even if I did cake on my makeup a tad too much, it makes me look realistic again and doesn't enhance my white-chocolate cake features. And I know it's wasteful, but it's always nice to have in the bathroom if only to whisk away the lingering aroma; that daily restroom functionalities seem to leave roaming.

However you decide to utilize this product, you really can't go wrong with this purchase.

title: My Favorite Facial Spray!
text:
I have been using this particular product for almost a year straight now. It took that long before I had to replace my bottle of near daily use.

Mario Badescu has hit it on the head with this one. It sprays a decent amount of product. I usually only spray 1-2 sprays and that about does it for my entire face. The smell is really great, but if you have a sensitive nose or can't do a super blast mist in the face then I probably wouldn't recommend this to you. The spray nozzle is perfect for me however. One of my favorite things is how quickly it moisturizes. I always use it right after washing my face with a cleanser that won't clog my pores. It gives my skin a very nice soft feel before I even apply my normal moisturizers. What else is so great that not only does it tone and moisturize but it can also be used as a setting spray. I would recommend using it as a setting spray during the winter rather the summer because of how cooling it is. I have sprayed more than one layer over my makeup during the winter and it never pulled any of it off and kept my face from becoming dry. An amazing product at an amazing price.

title: Made me breakout
text: I purchased this because I was in the market for a facial spray and this one came highly recommended, not only here on amazon but on other review sights such as Makeup Alley. I used this product consecutively for about a month and began to break out, it was the only new addition to my skin care routine and once I stopped using this my breakouts subsided. I really wanted to like this and was actually surprised by my skin's adverse reaction to it as I both adore and frequently use many other Mario Badescu products with great results. I have combination-oily skin and felt that it exasperated my oiliness and for that reason I don't recommend this for other combination/oily skinned individuals. However I passed this onto my mom who has sensitive/dry skin and she loves it and uses it morning and night. On a side note, the scent was just right; it wasn't over powering, yet when sprayed you definitely know that you're using a product that contains rose extract, which I personally like. Though despite my negative review on this particular item, I encourage people to try other Mario Badescu products as I think its a wonderful brand.

title: NOT worth the irritation.
text:
DO NOT BUY THIS.

I purchased this for two reasons: 1) an extra boost of moisture 2) I love the smell.
I was using it for about 2 weeks, after washing my face for moisture and I even used it to set my makeup. I started noticing these small bumps that weren't pimples on my face and it turns out it was the rose water causing it. The chemicals in this, particularly, geraniol, can irritate your skin. The flower extracts pose a risk for irritation too. t's been 2 weeks since I stopped using it and my skin is going back to normal but very very slowly.
All in all, I would not recommend, it's simply not worth it taking such a risk with this product. I'm sure some people use it with no issue, but those people probably used the older version of this mist, which had a shorter ingredient list.
Even if you end up being lucky enough to not be irritated, it does not do wonders to your skin, so save your money and most importantly your skin from this.

title: Warning about ingredients
text: There are more ingredients listed on the actual bottle than are listed on the Amazon description. I unfortunately trusted what was on the Amazon description which I took a screenshot of prior & did one Spritz on my face and immediately my face started burning. I immediately looked at the bottle and saw extra ingredients. This may not affect most but I wanted to give my honest experience for those who may have sensitive skin. I will go back to my regular rose water.

title: Best Facial Mist ❤️
text:
I haven’t had any facial mist before so, I was kinda skeptical about buying this because of my skin type. However, I went ahead with the purchase due to the positive reviews I read, and I’m so glad I did.

I’ve been using it for the past few days and I love how it makes my face glowy. It adds the perfect finish to my morning skincare routine.

title: Pretty Good
text: Overall this is a pretty decent spay to spritz on your face before you leave the house. I wouldn’t recommend it as a moisturizer for people with dry skin because it is so light, but if you have low maintenance skin it would be fine. It has a decent scent and is very light. My main concern is that it leaves my skin very sticky if i use it as a refresher or makeup setter which is not ideal.

title: I was very happy to recieve this product
text: At first, I was very happy to recieve this product.It seemed to do everything it claimed. However after one day use (twice) I noticed my normally clear skin breaking out badly. I researched the ingredients and found Propylene Glycol is very bad for the skin. I would not recommend this to anyone who cares about their skin. Amazon was great with the refund process. I would give this NO stars and shame on MB for using such an awful ingredient.

title: DRY SKIN REVIEW 10/10
text: So glad I ordered the largest one. I can see why this is so great. I've been using it as primer, and setting spray. Sometimes to keep beach waves in tact I'll spray in my hair. I would NOT recommend this for oily skin. But for texas dry skin this is a 10!
